images.title: York St John University said that the cases are 'unconnected and do not constitute an outbreak'

objects.author: Charles Gray
objects.title: Coronavirus cases confirmed at York St John University but they stress it is not an outbreak
objects.html:
York St John university has confirmed that there have been a number of cases of coronavirus recorded as universities across the country experience surges.

The university has stated that "fewer than 10 Covid-19 cases amongst staff and students" have been reported and that they are "unconnected and do not constitute an outbreak".

The university has also said that "close contacts have been informed and are isolating accordingly".

The university is among a list of 32 universities to have recorded coronavirus cases in the UK compiled by Sky News, which found that 640 cases have been confirmed among students and staff since universities reopened.

The worst hit universities are Manchester Metropolitan University and the University of Glasgow, which have recorded hundreds of cases and subsequently asked thousands of students between them to self-isolate for two weeks.

There have also been hundreds of other cases confirmed in other Scottish universities in Edinburgh and Dundee.

The University and College Union (UCU) warned that the outbreaks seen predominantly in Scotland - where the university term starts earlier than the rest of the UK - could be a preview of what will happen elsewhere if measures to limit the spread of coronavirus are not taken.

Asked about the reported cases, a spokesman for York St John University said: "Since the beginning of term on 21 September, York St John University has reported fewer than 10 positive COVID 19 cases amongst staff and students.

"All cases are unconnected and do not constitute an outbreak. Close contacts have been informed and are isolating accordingly."

The University and College Union (UCU) warned that the outbreaks seen predominantly in Scotland - where the university term starts earlier than the rest of the UK - could be a preview of what will happen elsewhere if measures to limit the spread of coronavirus are not taken.
